content.text:
The issue is that Entire is in **`manual-commit` mode**. In this mode, checkpoints are only created when you explicitly tell it to — it doesn't automatically link sessions to commits.

The Entire dashboard confirms "sessions exist but none are linked to commits on `main`" — meaning the hooks are recording sessions, but no checkpoints have been created from them.

You have two options:

1. **Switch to auto-commit mode** so Entire automatically creates checkpoints on every commit:
   ```
   entire enable --strategy auto-commit
   ```

2. **Keep manual mode** and explicitly create checkpoints when you want them (check `entire --help` for the checkpoint command).

Want me to switch it to auto-commit?
I already switched. So from now on every time I commit Entire will link our chat to the commit?

content.content:
1→# Safecast MCP Server connecting to simplemap.safeplease commit and psu.cast.org
     2→
     3→An MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that exposes [Safecast](https://safecast.org) radiation monitoring data to AI assistants like Claude. The server provides 15 tools for querying both real-time sensor readings and historical radiation measurements, browsing sensor tracks, spectroscopy data, analytics, and educational reference data.
     4→
     5→## Features
     6→
     7→- **15 tools** for querying Safecast radiation data
     8→- **Real-time and historical data access**: Query both real-time sensor readings and historical measurements
     9→- **Dual transport**: SSE and Streamable HTTP (works with Claude.ai)
    10→- **PostgreSQL + PostGIS** for fast spatial queries (with REST API fallback)
    11→- **DuckDB analytics** for usage statistics and aggregate queries
    12→- **Read-only** access to public Safecast data
    13→
    14→## Tools Overview
    15→
    16→| Tool | Data Type | Description |
    17→|------|-----------|-------------|
    18→| `query_radiation` | Historical | Find measurements near a lat/lon coordinate |
    19→| `search_area` | Historical | Search within a geographic bounding box |
    20→| `list_tracks` | Historical | Browse bGeigie Import tracks by year/month |
    21→| `get_track` | Historical | Get measurements from a specific track |
    22→| `device_history` | Mixed | Historical data from a monitoring device (supports both bGeigie and real-time sensors) |
    23→| `list_sensors` | Real-time | Discover active fixed sensors (Pointcast, Solarcast, bGeigieZen, etc.) by location or type |
    24→| `sensor_current` | Real-time | Get the latest reading(s) from a specific sensor or from all sensors in a geographic area |
    25→| `sensor_history` | Real-time | Pull time-series data from a fixed sensor over a date range |
    26→| `list_spectra` | Historical | Browse and search gamma spectroscopy records |
    27→| `get_spectrum` | Historical | Get full spectroscopy channel data for a measurement |
    28→| `radiation_info` | Reference | Educational reference (units, safety levels, detectors, isotopes) |
    29→| `radiation_stats` | Aggregate | Aggregate radiation statistics by year/month |
    30→| `query_analytics` | Analytics | Server usage statistics (call counts, durations) |
    31→| `db_info` | Diagnostic | Database connection and status (diagnostic) |
    32→| `ping` | Diagnostic | Health check |
    33→
    34→## Real-time Data Access
    35→
    36→The Safecast MCP server provides access to real-time radiation data from fixed sensors (Pointcast, Solarcast, bGeigieZen, etc.) through dedicated tools. These tools query the `realtime_measurements` table in the PostgreSQL database to retrieve the most current readings from active sensors.
    37→
    38→### Real-time Tools
    39→- `list_sensors`: Discover active fixed sensors by location or type
    40→- `sensor_current`: Get the latest reading(s) from specific sensors or geographic areas
    41→- `sensor_history`: Pull time-series data from fixed sensors over date ranges
    42→- `device_history`: Access both historical bGeigie data and real-time sensor data for a specific device
    43→
    44→> **Note**: Real-time data tools require a database connection to access the `realtime_measurements` table. These tools will fall back to the Safecast REST API if no database is configured.
    45→
    46→## Tool Reference
    47→
    48→### query_radiation
    49→
    50→Find radiation measurements near a geographic location. Returns measurements within a specified radius, sorted by most recent.
    51→
    52→| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
    53→|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
    54→| `lat` | number | Yes | | Latitude (-90 to 90) |
    55→| `lon` | number | Yes | | Longitude (-180 to 180) |
    56→| `radius_m` | number | No | 1500 | Search radius in meters (25 to 50,000) |
    57→| `limit` | number | No | 25 | Max results (1 to 10,000) |
    58→
    59→**Example**: Find measurements within 5km of Fukushima Daiichi:
    60→```json
    61→{"name": "query_radiation", "arguments": {"lat": 37.42, "lon": 141.03, "radius_m": 5000}}
    62→```
    63→
    64→Each result includes: `id`, `value` (dose rate in uSv/h), `captured_at`, `location` (lat/lon), `device_id`, `detector`, `track_id`, `has_spectrum`, and `distance_m`.
    65→
    66→---
    67→
    68→### search_area
    69→
    70→Find radiation measurements within a geographic bounding box.
    71→
    72→| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
    73→|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
    74→| `min_lat` | number | Yes | | Southern boundary latitude |
    75→| `max_lat` | number | Yes | | Northern boundary latitude |
    76→| `min_lon` | number | Yes | | Western boundary longitude |
    77→| `max_lon` | number | Yes | | Eastern boundary longitude |
    78→| `limit` | number | No | 100 | Max results (1 to 10,000) |
    79→
    80→**Example**: Search the Tokyo metropolitan area:
    81→```json
    82→{"name": "search_area", "arguments": {"min_lat": 35.5, "max_lat": 35.8, "min_lon": 139.5, "max_lon": 139.9}}
    83→```
    84→
    85→---
    86→
    87→### list_tracks
    88→
    89→Browse bGeigie Import tracks (bulk radiation measurement drives/journeys). Each track represents a set of measurements collected during a single bGeigie session.
    90→
    91→| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
    92→|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
    93→| `year` | number | No | | Filter by year (2000-2100) |
    94→| `month` | number | No | | Filter by month (1-12, requires `year`) |
    95→| `limit` | number | No | 50 | Max results (1 to 50,000) |
    96→
    97→**Example**: Browse tracks from January 2024:
    98→```json
    99→{"name": "list_tracks", "arguments": {"year": 2024, "month": 1}}
   100→```
   101→
   102→Each result includes: `track_id`, `name`, `description`, `city`, `measurement_count`, `created_at`, and status info.
   103→
   104→---
   105→
   106→### get_track
   107→
   108→Retrieve all radiation measurements from a specific track/journey. Use `list_tracks` to find track IDs first.
   109→
   110→| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
   111→|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
   112→| `track_id` | string | Yes | | Track identifier |
   113→| `from` | number | No | | Start marker ID for filtering |
   114→| `to` | number | No | | End marker ID for filtering |
   115→| `limit` | number | No | 200 | Max results (1 to 10,000) |
   116→
   117→**Example**: Get measurements from a specific track:
   118→```json
   119→{"name": "get_track", "arguments": {"track_id": "8eh5m1"}}
   120→```
   121→
   122→---
   123→
   124→### device_history
   125→
   126→Get historical radiation measurements from a specific monitoring device over a time period. This tool now supports both bGeigie import data and real-time sensor data.
   127→
   128→| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
   129→|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
   130→| `device_id` | string | Yes | | Device identifier |
   131→| `days` | number | No | 30 | Days of history (1 to 365) |
   132→| `limit` | number | No | 200 | Max results (1 to 10,000) |
   133→
   134→**Example**: Get 90 days of history from a device:
   135→```json
   136→{"name": "device_history", "arguments": {"device_id": "12345", "days": 90}}
   137→```
   138→
   139→> **Note**: This tool queries both the `markers` table (for bGeigie imports) and the `realtime_measurements` table (for fixed sensors) to provide a comprehensive history from the specified device.
   140→
   141→---
   142→
   143→### list_sensors
   144→
   145→Discover active fixed sensors (Pointcast, Solarcast, bGeigieZen, etc.) by location or type, returning device IDs, locations, status, and last reading timestamp.
   146→
   147→| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
   148→|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
   149→| `type` | string | No | | Filter by sensor type (e.g., 'Pointcast', 'Solarcast', 'bGeigieZen') |
   150→| `min_lat` | number | No | -90 | Southern boundary for geographic filter |
   151→| `max_lat` | number | No | 90 | Northern boundary for geographic filter |
   152→| `min_lon` | number | No | -180 | Western boundary for geographic filter |
   153→| `max_lon` | number | No | 180 | Eastern boundary for geographic filter |
   154→| `limit` | number | No | 50 | Max results (1 to 1000) |
   155→
   156→**Example**: Find all Pointcast sensors in Japan:
   157→```json
   158→{"name": "list_sensors", "arguments": {"type": "Pointcast", "min_lat": 30, "max_lat": 46, "min_lon": 129, "max_lon": 146}}
   159→```
   160→
   161→> **Note**: Requires database connection to access `realtime_measurements` table.
   162→
   163→---
   164→
   165→### sensor_current
   166→
   167→Get the latest reading(s) from a specific sensor or from all sensors in a geographic area.
   168→
   169→| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
   170→|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
   171→| `device_id` | string | No | | Specific device ID to get latest reading from |
   172→| `min_lat` | number | No | -90 | Southern boundary for geographic filter |
   173→| `max_lat` | number | No | 90 | Northern boundary for geographic filter |
   174→| `min_lon` | number | No | -180 | Western boundary for geographic filter |
   175→| `max_lon` | number | No | 180 | Eastern boundary for geographic filter |
   176→| `limit` | number | No | 25 | Max results (1 to 1000) |
   177→
   178→**Example**: Get latest reading from a specific sensor:
   179→```json
   180→{"name": "sensor_current", "arguments": {"device_id": "sensor-123"}}
   181→```
   182→
   183→**Example**: Get latest readings from all sensors in Tokyo:
   184→```json
   185→{"name": "sensor_current", "arguments": {"min_lat": 35.5, "max_lat": 35.8, "min_lon": 139.5, "max_lon": 139.9, "limit": 50}}
   186→```
   187→
   188→> **Note**: Requires database connection to access `realtime_measurements` table.
   189→
   190→---
   191→
   192→### sensor_history
   193→
   194→Pull time-series data from a fixed sensor over a date range.
   195→
   196→| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
   197→|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
   198→| `device_id` | string | Yes | | Device identifier to get historical data from |
   199→| `start_date` | string | Yes | | Start date in YYYY-MM-DD format |
   200→| `end_date` | string | No | Today | End date in YYYY-MM-DD format |
   201→| `limit` | number | No | 200 | Max results (1 to 10,000) |
   202→
   203→**Example**: Get 30 days of history from a sensor:
   204→```json
   205→{"name": "sensor_history", "arguments": {"device_id": "sensor-123", "start_date": "2024-01-01", "end_date": "2024-01-31"}}
   206→```
   207→
   208→> **Note**: Requires database connection to access `realtime_measurements` table.
   209→
   210→---
   211→
   212→### list_spectra
   213→
   214→Browse and search gamma spectroscopy records. Returns metadata (filename, device, energy range, location) **without** the full channel data. Use `get_spectrum` with a `marker_id` from the results to fetch full channel data.
   215→
   216→| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
   217→|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
   218→| `min_lat` | number | No | | Southern boundary (requires all 4 bbox params) |
   219→| `max_lat` | number | No | | Northern boundary (requires all 4 bbox params) |
   220→| `min_lon` | number | No | | Western boundary (requires all 4 bbox params) |
   221→| `max_lon` | number | No | | Eastern boundary (requires all 4 bbox params) |
   222→| `source_format` | string | No | | Filter by file format (e.g., `"spe"`, `"csv"`) |
   223→| `device_model` | string | No | | Filter by detector name (partial match) |
   224→| `track_id` | string | No | | Filter by track identifier (e.g., `"8eh5m1"`, `"8ZnI7f"`) |
   225→| `limit` | number | No | 50 | Max results (1 to 500) |
   226→
   227→**Example**: Find all SPE spectrum files:
   228→```json
   229→{"name": "list_spectra", "arguments": {"source_format": "spe"}}
   230→```
   231→
   232→**Example**: Browse all spectra (no filters):
   233→```json
   234→{"name": "list_spectra", "arguments": {}}
   235→```
   236→
   237→**Example**: Get all spectrum files for a specific track:
   238→```json
   239→{"name": "list_spectra", "arguments": {"track_id": "8eh5m1"}}
   240→```
   241→
   242→**Example**: Get all spectrum files regardless of track (no filters):
   243→```json
   244→{"name": "list_spectra", "arguments": {"limit": 100}}
   245→```
   246→
   247→Each result includes: `spectrum_id`, `marker_id`, `filename`, `source_format`, `device_model`, `channel_count`, `energy_range`, `live_time_sec`, `calibration`, `created_at`, and nested `marker` with location and track_id.
   248→
   249→> **Note**: Requires database connection. No REST API fallback.
   250→
   251→---
   252→
   253→### get_spectrum
   254→
   255→Get full gamma spectroscopy channel data for a specific measurement point. Returns the complete spectrum including all channel counts.
   256→
   257→| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
   258→|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
   259→| `marker_id` | number | Yes | | Marker/measurement identifier (get from `list_spectra`) |
   260→
   261→**Example**:
   262→```json
   263→{"name": "get_spectrum", "arguments": {"marker_id": 4902886}}
   264→```
   265→
   266→Returns: `channels` (array of counts), `channel_count`, `energy_min_kev`, `energy_max_kev`, `live_time_sec`, `real_time_sec`, `device_model`, `calibration`, `source_format`, `filename`, plus marker location and dose rate.
   267→
   268→---
   269→
   270→### radiation_info
   271→
   272→Get educational reference information about radiation. Returns static content.
   273→
   274→| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
   275→|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
   276→| `topic` | string | Yes | | One of: `units`, `dose_rates`, `safety_levels`, `detectors`, `background_levels`, `isotopes` |
   277→
   278→**Topics**:
   279→- `units` -- Explanation of uSv/h, CPM, Bq, Sv
   280→- `dose_rates` -- Typical dose rate ranges and what they mean
   281→- `safety_levels` -- International safety standards and thresholds
   282→- `detectors` -- Types of radiation detectors and how they work
   283→- `background_levels` -- Natural background radiation by region
   284→- `isotopes` -- Common radioactive isotopes and their properties
   285→
   286→---
   287→
   288→### radiation_stats
   289→
   290→Get aggregate radiation statistics from the Safecast database grouped by time interval. Powered by DuckDB + PostgreSQL.
   291→
   292→| Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description |
   293→|-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------|
   294→| `interval` | string | No | `"year"` | Aggregation: `"year"`, `"month"`, or `"overall"` |
   295→
   296→**Example**: Get yearly statistics:
   297→```json
   298→{"name": "radiation_stats", "arguments": {"interval": "year"}}
   299→```
   300→
   301→---
   302→
   303→### query_analytics
   304→
   305→Get usage statistics for all MCP tools including call counts, average duration, and max duration. Powered by DuckDB local logs. No parameters required.
   306→
   307→---
   308→
   309→### db_info
   310→
   311→Diagnostic tool that returns database connection info, PostgreSQL version, replication status, and upload counts. No parameters required.
   312→
   313→---
   314→
   315→### ping
   316→
   317→Health check. Returns `"pong"`. No parameters required.
   318→
   319→## Quick Start
   320→
   321→```bash
   322→cd go
   323→go build -o safecast-mcp ./cmd/mcp-server/
   324→./safecast-mcp
   325→```
   326→
   327→The server listens on port 3333 by default and provides access to both historical bGeigie data and real-time sensor readings.
   328→
   329→### Environment Variables
   330→
   331→| Variable | Required | Description |
   332→|----------|----------|-------------|
   333→| `MCP_BASE_URL` | No | Base URL advertised by the SSE transport so clients know where to POST messages back (default: `http://localhost:3333`). Must **not** include `/mcp` — the server appends that automatically. |
   334→| `DATABASE_URL` | No | PostgreSQL connection string. If not set, uses the Safecast REST API. |
   335→
   336→### Endpoints
   337→
   338→- **SSE**: `/mcp/sse` (GET) and `/mcp/message` (POST)
   339→- **Streamable HTTP**: `/mcp-http` (POST)
   340→
   341→## Connecting to Claude.ai
   342→
   343→1. Open [claude.ai](https://claude.ai) in your browser
   344→2. Go to **Settings** (bottom-left) > **Integrations**
   345→3. Click **Add more** > **Add custom integration**
   346→4. Enter a name (e.g. "Safecast") and paste the Streamable HTTP endpoint URL:
   347→   ```
   348→   https://vps-01.safecast.jp/mcp-http
   349→   ```
   350→5. Click **Save** — the Safecast tools will now be available in your conversations
   351→
   352→## Architecture
   353→
   354→```
   355→Claude / AI client
   356→    |
   357→    v
   358→MCP Server (Go, mcp-go)
   359→    |
   360→    +---> PostgreSQL + PostGIS (primary, if DATABASE_URL set)
   361→          |
   362→          +---> markers table (historical bGeigie data)
   363→          |
   364→          +---> realtime_measurements table (real-time sensor data)
   365→          |
   366→          +---> spectra table (spectroscopy data)
   367→    |
   368→    +---> simplemap.safecast.org REST API (fallback)
   369→```
   370→
   371→The server uses [`mcp-go`](https://github.com/mark3labs/mcp-go) for MCP protocol support. All tools attempt a direct database query first and fall back to the Safecast REST API if no database is configured or the query fails. Real-time data tools specifically query the `realtime_measurements` table for current sensor readings.
   372→
   373→## Project Structure
   374→
   375→```
   376→go/cmd/mcp-server/
   377→  main.go              # Server setup, tool registration, dual transport
   378→  api_client.go        # Safecast REST API client
   379→  db_client.go         # PostgreSQL connection pool (pgx)
   380→  duckdb_client.go     # DuckDB analytics engine
   381→  reference_data.go    # Static radiation reference data
   382→  tool_query_radiation.go
   383→  tool_search_area.go
   384→  tool_list_tracks.go
   385→  tool_get_track.go
   386→  tool_device_history.go
   387→  tool_get_spectrum.go
   388→  tool_list_spectra.go
   389→  tool_radiation_info.go
   390→  tool_analytics.go
   391→  tool_db_info.go
   392→```
   393→
   394→## Development
   395→
   396→```bash
   397→cd go
   398→go run ./cmd/mcp-server/
   399→```
   400→
   401→Cross-compile for Linux deployment:
   402→
   403→```bash
   404→cd go
   405→GOOS=linux GOARCH=amd64 go build -o safecast-mcp ./cmd/mcp-server/
   406→```
   407→
   408→## Deployment
   409→
   410→Pushing to `main` automatically builds and deploys to the VPS via GitHub Actions (only when Go source files, `go.mod`/`go.sum`, or the workflow itself change).
   411→
   412→### How it works
   413→
   414→1. GitHub Action cross-compiles the Go binary
   415→2. Uploads it to the VPS via rsync
   416→3. Restarts the MCP server
   417→4. Runs a health check against the `/mcp-http` endpoint
   418→
   419→### Setting up secrets
   420→
   421→The GitHub Action requires three repository secrets. Go to **Settings** > **Secrets and variables** > **Actions** and add:
   422→
   423→| Secret | Description |
   424→|--------|-------------|
   425→| `SSH_PRIVATE_KEY` | SSH private key with access to the VPS (ed25519 format) |
   426→| `VPS_HOST` | VPS hostname (e.g. `vps-01.safecast.jp`) |
   427→| `DATABASE_URL` | PostgreSQL connection string |
   428→
   429→To generate a deploy key:
   430→
   431→```bash
   432→ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "github-deploy@safecast-mcp" -f ~/.ssh/safecast-deploy -N ""
   433→```
   434→
   435→Then add the public key to the VPS:
   436→
   437→```bash
   438→ssh-copy-id -i ~/.ssh/safecast-deploy.pub root@vps-01.safecast.jp
   439→```
   440→
   441→And paste the contents of `~/.ssh/safecast-deploy` (the private key) as the `SSH_PRIVATE_KEY` secret in GitHub.
   442→
   443→### Manual deploy
   444→
   445→```bash
   446→cd go
   447→GOOS=linux GOARCH=amd64 go build -o safecast-mcp ./cmd/mcp-server/
   448→scp safecast-mcp root@vps-01.safecast.jp:/root/safecast-mcp-server/
   449→ssh root@vps-01.safecast.jp "systemctl restart safecast-mcp"
   450→```
   451→
   452→## Contributing
   453→
   454→Contributions welcome. If changing a tool's interface, please open an issue first. Fork, branch, PR.
   455→
   456→## License
   457→
   458→MIT
   459→
   460→<a href="https://www.paypal.com/ncp/payment/MAXS4ZUSGPDD4">
   461→  <img src="https://safecast.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Donation-PayPal-1.png" border="0" alt="Donate with PayPal" />
   462→</a>
   463→
   464→

file.content: # Safecast MCP Server connecting to simplemap.safeplease commit and psu.cast.org An MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that exposes [Safecast](https://safecast.org) radiation monitoring data to AI assistants like Claude. The server provides 15 tools for querying both real-time sensor readings and historical radiation measurements, browsing sensor tracks, spectroscopy data, analytics, and educational reference data. ## Features - **15 tools** for querying Safecast radiation data - **Real-time and historical data access**: Query both real-time sensor readings and historical measurements - **Dual transport**: SSE and Streamable HTTP (works with Claude.ai) - **PostgreSQL + PostGIS** for fast spatial queries (with REST API fallback) - **DuckDB analytics** for usage statistics and aggregate queries - **Read-only** access to public Safecast data ## Tools Overview | Tool | Data Type | Description | |------|-----------|-------------| | `query_radiation` | Historical | Find measurements near a lat/lon coordinate | | `search_area` | Historical | Search within a geographic bounding box | | `list_tracks` | Historical | Browse bGeigie Import tracks by year/month | | `get_track` | Historical | Get measurements from a specific track | | `device_history` | Mixed | Historical data from a monitoring device (supports both bGeigie and real-time sensors) | | `list_sensors` | Real-time | Discover active fixed sensors (Pointcast, Solarcast, bGeigieZen, etc.) by location or type | | `sensor_current` | Real-time | Get the latest reading(s) from a specific sensor or from all sensors in a geographic area | | `sensor_history` | Real-time | Pull time-series data from a fixed sensor over a date range | | `list_spectra` | Historical | Browse and search gamma spectroscopy records | | `get_spectrum` | Historical | Get full spectroscopy channel data for a measurement | | `radiation_info` | Reference | Educational reference (units, safety levels, detectors, isotopes) | | `radiation_stats` | Aggregate | Aggregate radiation statistics by year/month | | `query_analytics` | Analytics | Server usage statistics (call counts, durations) | | `db_info` | Diagnostic | Database connection and status (diagnostic) | | `ping` | Diagnostic | Health check | ## Real-time Data Access The Safecast MCP server provides access to real-time radiation data from fixed sensors (Pointcast, Solarcast, bGeigieZen, etc.) through dedicated tools. These tools query the `realtime_measurements` table in the PostgreSQL database to retrieve the most current readings from active sensors. ### Real-time Tools - `list_sensors`: Discover active fixed sensors by location or type - `sensor_current`: Get the latest reading(s) from specific sensors or geographic areas - `sensor_history`: Pull time-series data from fixed sensors over date ranges - `device_history`: Access both historical bGeigie data and real-time sensor data for a specific device > **Note**: Real-time data tools require a database connection to access the `realtime_measurements` table. These tools will fall back to the Safecast REST API if no database is configured. ## Tool Reference ### query_radiation Find radiation measurements near a geographic location. Returns measurements within a specified radius, sorted by most recent. | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | |-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------| | `lat` | number | Yes | | Latitude (-90 to 90) | | `lon` | number | Yes | | Longitude (-180 to 180) | | `radius_m` | number | No | 1500 | Search radius in meters (25 to 50,000) | | `limit` | number | No | 25 | Max results (1 to 10,000) | **Example**: Find measurements within 5km of Fukushima Daiichi: ```json {"name": "query_radiation", "arguments": {"lat": 37.42, "lon": 141.03, "radius_m": 5000}} ``` Each result includes: `id`, `value` (dose rate in uSv/h), `captured_at`, `location` (lat/lon), `device_id`, `detector`, `track_id`, `has_spectrum`, and `distance_m`. --- ### search_area Find radiation measurements within a geographic bounding box. | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | |-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------| | `min_lat` | number | Yes | | Southern boundary latitude | | `max_lat` | number | Yes | | Northern boundary latitude | | `min_lon` | number | Yes | | Western boundary longitude | | `max_lon` | number | Yes | | Eastern boundary longitude | | `limit` | number | No | 100 | Max results (1 to 10,000) | **Example**: Search the Tokyo metropolitan area: ```json {"name": "search_area", "arguments": {"min_lat": 35.5, "max_lat": 35.8, "min_lon": 139.5, "max_lon": 139.9}} ``` --- ### list_tracks Browse bGeigie Import tracks (bulk radiation measurement drives/journeys). Each track represents a set of measurements collected during a single bGeigie session. | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | |-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------| | `year` | number | No | | Filter by year (2000-2100) | | `month` | number | No | | Filter by month (1-12, requires `year`) | | `limit` | number | No | 50 | Max results (1 to 50,000) | **Example**: Browse tracks from January 2024: ```json {"name": "list_tracks", "arguments": {"year": 2024, "month": 1}} ``` Each result includes: `track_id`, `name`, `description`, `city`, `measurement_count`, `created_at`, and status info. --- ### get_track Retrieve all radiation measurements from a specific track/journey. Use `list_tracks` to find track IDs first. | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | |-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------| | `track_id` | string | Yes | | Track identifier | | `from` | number | No | | Start marker ID for filtering | | `to` | number | No | | End marker ID for filtering | | `limit` | number | No | 200 | Max results (1 to 10,000) | **Example**: Get measurements from a specific track: ```json {"name": "get_track", "arguments": {"track_id": "8eh5m1"}} ``` --- ### device_history Get historical radiation measurements from a specific monitoring device over a time period. This tool now supports both bGeigie import data and real-time sensor data. | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | |-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------| | `device_id` | string | Yes | | Device identifier | | `days` | number | No | 30 | Days of history (1 to 365) | | `limit` | number | No | 200 | Max results (1 to 10,000) | **Example**: Get 90 days of history from a device: ```json {"name": "device_history", "arguments": {"device_id": "12345", "days": 90}} ``` > **Note**: This tool queries both the `markers` table (for bGeigie imports) and the `realtime_measurements` table (for fixed sensors) to provide a comprehensive history from the specified device. --- ### list_sensors Discover active fixed sensors (Pointcast, Solarcast, bGeigieZen, etc.) by location or type, returning device IDs, locations, status, and last reading timestamp. | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | |-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------| | `type` | string | No | | Filter by sensor type (e.g., 'Pointcast', 'Solarcast', 'bGeigieZen') | | `min_lat` | number | No | -90 | Southern boundary for geographic filter | | `max_lat` | number | No | 90 | Northern boundary for geographic filter | | `min_lon` | number | No | -180 | Western boundary for geographic filter | | `max_lon` | number | No | 180 | Eastern boundary for geographic filter | | `limit` | number | No | 50 | Max results (1 to 1000) | **Example**: Find all Pointcast sensors in Japan: ```json {"name": "list_sensors", "arguments": {"type": "Pointcast", "min_lat": 30, "max_lat": 46, "min_lon": 129, "max_lon": 146}} ``` > **Note**: Requires database connection to access `realtime_measurements` table. --- ### sensor_current Get the latest reading(s) from a specific sensor or from all sensors in a geographic area. | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | |-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------| | `device_id` | string | No | | Specific device ID to get latest reading from | | `min_lat` | number | No | -90 | Southern boundary for geographic filter | | `max_lat` | number | No | 90 | Northern boundary for geographic filter | | `min_lon` | number | No | -180 | Western boundary for geographic filter | | `max_lon` | number | No | 180 | Eastern boundary for geographic filter | | `limit` | number | No | 25 | Max results (1 to 1000) | **Example**: Get latest reading from a specific sensor: ```json {"name": "sensor_current", "arguments": {"device_id": "sensor-123"}} ``` **Example**: Get latest readings from all sensors in Tokyo: ```json {"name": "sensor_current", "arguments": {"min_lat": 35.5, "max_lat": 35.8, "min_lon": 139.5, "max_lon": 139.9, "limit": 50}} ``` > **Note**: Requires database connection to access `realtime_measurements` table. --- ### sensor_history Pull time-series data from a fixed sensor over a date range. | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | |-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------| | `device_id` | string | Yes | | Device identifier to get historical data from | | `start_date` | string | Yes | | Start date in YYYY-MM-DD format | | `end_date` | string | No | Today | End date in YYYY-MM-DD format | | `limit` | number | No | 200 | Max results (1 to 10,000) | **Example**: Get 30 days of history from a sensor: ```json {"name": "sensor_history", "arguments": {"device_id": "sensor-123", "start_date": "2024-01-01", "end_date": "2024-01-31"}} ``` > **Note**: Requires database connection to access `realtime_measurements` table. --- ### list_spectra Browse and search gamma spectroscopy records. Returns metadata (filename, device, energy range, location) **without** the full channel data. Use `get_spectrum` with a `marker_id` from the results to fetch full channel data. | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | |-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------| | `min_lat` | number | No | | Southern boundary (requires all 4 bbox params) | | `max_lat` | number | No | | Northern boundary (requires all 4 bbox params) | | `min_lon` | number | No | | Western boundary (requires all 4 bbox params) | | `max_lon` | number | No | | Eastern boundary (requires all 4 bbox params) | | `source_format` | string | No | | Filter by file format (e.g., `"spe"`, `"csv"`) | | `device_model` | string | No | | Filter by detector name (partial match) | | `track_id` | string | No | | Filter by track identifier (e.g., `"8eh5m1"`, `"8ZnI7f"`) | | `limit` | number | No | 50 | Max results (1 to 500) | **Example**: Find all SPE spectrum files: ```json {"name": "list_spectra", "arguments": {"source_format": "spe"}} ``` **Example**: Browse all spectra (no filters): ```json {"name": "list_spectra", "arguments": {}} ``` **Example**: Get all spectrum files for a specific track: ```json {"name": "list_spectra", "arguments": {"track_id": "8eh5m1"}} ``` **Example**: Get all spectrum files regardless of track (no filters): ```json {"name": "list_spectra", "arguments": {"limit": 100}} ``` Each result includes: `spectrum_id`, `marker_id`, `filename`, `source_format`, `device_model`, `channel_count`, `energy_range`, `live_time_sec`, `calibration`, `created_at`, and nested `marker` with location and track_id. > **Note**: Requires database connection. No REST API fallback. --- ### get_spectrum Get full gamma spectroscopy channel data for a specific measurement point. Returns the complete spectrum including all channel counts. | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | |-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------| | `marker_id` | number | Yes | | Marker/measurement identifier (get from `list_spectra`) | **Example**: ```json {"name": "get_spectrum", "arguments": {"marker_id": 4902886}} ``` Returns: `channels` (array of counts), `channel_count`, `energy_min_kev`, `energy_max_kev`, `live_time_sec`, `real_time_sec`, `device_model`, `calibration`, `source_format`, `filename`, plus marker location and dose rate. --- ### radiation_info Get educational reference information about radiation. Returns static content. | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | |-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------| | `topic` | string | Yes | | One of: `units`, `dose_rates`, `safety_levels`, `detectors`, `background_levels`, `isotopes` | **Topics**: - `units` -- Explanation of uSv/h, CPM, Bq, Sv - `dose_rates` -- Typical dose rate ranges and what they mean - `safety_levels` -- International safety standards and thresholds - `detectors` -- Types of radiation detectors and how they work - `background_levels` -- Natural background radiation by region - `isotopes` -- Common radioactive isotopes and their properties --- ### radiation_stats Get aggregate radiation statistics from the Safecast database grouped by time interval. Powered by DuckDB + PostgreSQL. | Parameter | Type | Required | Default | Description | |-----------|------|----------|---------|-------------| | `interval` | string | No | `"year"` | Aggregation: `"year"`, `"month"`, or `"overall"` | **Example**: Get yearly statistics: ```json {"name": "radiation_stats", "arguments": {"interval": "year"}} ``` --- ### query_analytics Get usage statistics for all MCP tools including call counts, average duration, and max duration. Powered by DuckDB local logs. No parameters required. --- ### db_info Diagnostic tool that returns database connection info, PostgreSQL version, replication status, and upload counts. No parameters required. --- ### ping Health check. Returns `"pong"`. No parameters required. ## Quick Start ```bash cd go go build -o safecast-mcp ./cmd/mcp-server/ ./safecast-mcp ``` The server listens on port 3333 by default and provides access to both historical bGeigie data and real-time sensor readings. ### Environment Variables | Variable | Required | Description | |----------|----------|-------------| | `MCP_BASE_URL` | No | Base URL advertised by the SSE transport so clients know where to POST messages back (default: `http://localhost:3333`). Must **not** include `/mcp` — the server appends that automatically. | | `DATABASE_URL` | No | PostgreSQL connection string. If not set, uses the Safecast REST API. | ### Endpoints - **SSE**: `/mcp/sse` (GET) and `/mcp/message` (POST) - **Streamable HTTP**: `/mcp-http` (POST) ## Connecting to Claude.ai 1. Open [claude.ai](https://claude.ai) in your browser 2. Go to **Settings** (bottom-left) > **Integrations** 3. Click **Add more** > **Add custom integration** 4. Enter a name (e.g. "Safecast") and paste the Streamable HTTP endpoint URL: ``` https://vps-01.safecast.jp/mcp-http ``` 5. Click **Save** — the Safecast tools will now be available in your conversations ## Architecture ``` Claude / AI client | v MCP Server (Go, mcp-go) | +---> PostgreSQL + PostGIS (primary, if DATABASE_URL set) | +---> markers table (historical bGeigie data) | +---> realtime_measurements table (real-time sensor data) | +---> spectra table (spectroscopy data) | +---> simplemap.safecast.org REST API (fallback) ``` The server uses [`mcp-go`](https://github.com/mark3labs/mcp-go) for MCP protocol support. All tools attempt a direct database query first and fall back to the Safecast REST API if no database is configured or the query fails. Real-time data tools specifically query the `realtime_measurements` table for current sensor readings. ## Project Structure ``` go/cmd/mcp-server/ main.go # Server setup, tool registration, dual transport api_client.go # Safecast REST API client db_client.go # PostgreSQL connection pool (pgx) duckdb_client.go # DuckDB analytics engine reference_data.go # Static radiation reference data tool_query_radiation.go tool_search_area.go tool_list_tracks.go tool_get_track.go tool_device_history.go tool_get_spectrum.go tool_list_spectra.go tool_radiation_info.go tool_analytics.go tool_db_info.go ``` ## Development ```bash cd go go run ./cmd/mcp-server/ ``` Cross-compile for Linux deployment: ```bash cd go GOOS=linux GOARCH=amd64 go build -o safecast-mcp ./cmd/mcp-server/ ``` ## Deployment Pushing to `main` automatically builds and deploys to the VPS via GitHub Actions (only when Go source files, `go.mod`/`go.sum`, or the workflow itself change). ### How it works 1. GitHub Action cross-compiles the Go binary 2. Uploads it to the VPS via rsync 3. Restarts the MCP server 4. Runs a health check against the `/mcp-http` endpoint ### Setting up secrets The GitHub Action requires three repository secrets. Go to **Settings** > **Secrets and variables** > **Actions** and add: | Secret | Description | |--------|-------------| | `SSH_PRIVATE_KEY` | SSH private key with access to the VPS (ed25519 format) | | `VPS_HOST` | VPS hostname (e.g. `vps-01.safecast.jp`) | | `DATABASE_URL` | PostgreSQL connection string | To generate a deploy key: ```bash ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "github-deploy@safecast-mcp" -f ~/.ssh/safecast-deploy -N "" ``` Then add the public key to the VPS: ```bash ssh-copy-id -i ~/.ssh/safecast-deploy.pub root@vps-01.safecast.jp ``` And paste the contents of `~/.ssh/safecast-deploy` (the private key) as the `SSH_PRIVATE_KEY` secret in GitHub. ### Manual deploy ```bash cd go GOOS=linux GOARCH=amd64 go build -o safecast-mcp ./cmd/mcp-server/ scp safecast-mcp root@vps-01.safecast.jp:/root/safecast-mcp-server/ ssh root@vps-01.safecast.jp "systemctl restart safecast-mcp" ``` ## Contributing Contributions welcome. If changing a tool's interface, please open an issue first. Fork, branch, PR. ## License MIT

## Complete MCP Tool Definitions for Safecast Map MCP

- **Description:** Health check tool
- **Parameters:** (none)
- **File:** main.go

### 2. **query_radiation**
- **Description:** Find radiation measurements near a geographic location. Returns measurements within a specified radius of the given coordinates.
- **Parameters:**
  - `lat` (number, required): Latitude (-90 to 90)
  - `lon` (number, required): Longitude (-180 to 180)
  - `radius_m` (number, optional, default: 1500): Search radius in meters (default: 1500, max: 50000)
  - `limit` (number, optional, default: 25): Maximum number of results to return (default: 25, max: 10000)
- **File:** tool_query_radiation.go

### 3. **search_area**
- **Description:** Find radiation measurements within a geographic bounding box.
- **Parameters:**
  - `min_lat` (number, required): Southern boundary latitude
  - `max_lat` (number, required): Northern boundary latitude
  - `min_lon` (number, required): Western boundary longitude
  - `max_lon` (number, required): Eastern boundary longitude
  - `limit` (number, optional, default: 100): Maximum number of results to return (default: 100, max: 10000)
- **File:** tool_search_area.go

### 4. **list_tracks**
- **Description:** Browse bGeigie Import tracks (bulk radiation measurement drives). Can filter by year and optionally month.
- **Parameters:**
  - `year` (number, optional): Filter by year (e.g., 2024)
  - `month` (number, optional): Filter by month (1-12, requires year parameter)
  - `limit` (number, optional, default: 50): Maximum number of results to return (default: 50, max: 50000)
- **File:** tool_list_tracks.go

### 5. **get_track**
- **Description:** Retrieve all radiation measurements recorded during a specific track/journey. Use list_tracks to find available track IDs first.
- **Parameters:**
  - `track_id` (string, required): Track identifier (bGeigie import ID or track ID)
  - `from` (number, optional): Optional: Start marker ID for filtering
  - `to` (number, optional): Optional: End marker ID for filtering
  - `limit` (number, optional, default: 200): Maximum number of measurements to return (default: 200, max: 10000)
- **File:** tool_get_track.go

### 6. **device_history**
- **Description:** Get historical radiation measurements from a specific monitoring device over a time period.
- **Parameters:**
  - `device_id` (string, required): Device identifier
  - `days` (number, optional, default: 30): Number of days of history to retrieve (default: 30, max: 365)
  - `limit` (number, optional, default: 200): Maximum number of measurements to return (default: 200, max: 10000)
- **File:** tool_device_history.go

### 7. **get_spectrum**
- **Description:** Get gamma spectroscopy data for a specific measurement point.
- **Parameters:**
  - `marker_id` (number, required): Marker/measurement identifier
- **File:** tool_get_spectrum.go

### 8. **list_spectra**
- **Description:** Browse gamma spectroscopy records. Returns metadata without channel data. Use get_spectrum with a marker_id from results to fetch full channel data. Can filter by track ID, geographic bounds, file format, or device model. Call with no filters to get all spectra.
- **Parameters:**
  - `min_lat` (number, optional): Southern boundary latitude (requires all 4 bbox params)
  - `max_lat` (number, optional): Northern boundary latitude (requires all 4 bbox params)
  - `min_lon` (number, optional): Western boundary longitude (requires all 4 bbox params)
  - `max_lon` (number, optional): Eastern boundary longitude (requires all 4 bbox params)
  - `source_format` (string, optional): Filter by spectrum file format (e.g., 'spe', 'csv')
  - `device_model` (string, optional): Filter by detector/device model name
  - `track_id` (string, optional): Filter by track identifier (e.g., '8eh5m1', '8ZnI7f')
  - `limit` (number, optional, default: 50): Maximum number of results to return (default: 50, max: 500)
- **File:** tool_list_spectra.go

### 9. **radiation_info**
- **Description:** Get educational reference information about radiation units, safety levels, detectors, and related topics. Returns static reference content.
- **Parameters:**
  - `topic` (string, required, enum): Topic to retrieve information about

- **File:** tool_radiation_info.go

### 10. **db_info**
- **Description:** Get database connection information and replication status (diagnostic tool)
- **Parameters:** (none)
- **File:** tool_db_info.go

### 11. **list_sensors**
- **Description:** Discover active fixed sensors (Pointcast, Solarcast, bGeigieZen, etc.) by location or type, returning device IDs, locations, status, and last reading timestamp.
- **Parameters:**
  - `type` (string, optional): Filter by sensor type (e.g., 'Pointcast', 'Solarcast', 'bGeigieZen', etc.)
  - `min_lat` (number, optional): Southern boundary for geographic filter
  - `max_lat` (number, optional): Northern boundary for geographic filter
  - `min_lon` (number, optional): Western boundary for geographic filter
  - `max_lon` (number, optional): Eastern boundary for geographic filter
  - `limit` (number, optional, default: 50): Maximum number of sensors to return (default: 50, max: 1000)
- **File:** tool_list_sensors.go

### 12. **sensor_current**
- **Description:** Get the latest reading(s) from a specific sensor or from all sensors in a geographic area.
- **Parameters:**
  - `device_id` (string, optional): Specific device ID to get latest reading from
  - `min_lat` (number, optional): Southern boundary for geographic filter
  - `max_lat` (number, optional): Northern boundary for geographic filter
  - `min_lon` (number, optional): Western boundary for geographic filter
  - `max_lon` (number, optional): Eastern boundary for geographic filter
  - `limit` (number, optional, default: 25): Maximum number of readings to return (default: 25, max: 1000)
- **File:** tool_sensor_current.go

### 13. **sensor_history**
- **Description:** Pull time-series data from a fixed sensor over a date range.
- **Parameters:**
  - `device_id` (string, required): Device identifier to get historical data from
  - `start_date` (string, required): Start date in YYYY-MM-DD format
  - `end_date` (string, optional): End date in YYYY-MM-DD format (default: today)
  - `limit` (number, optional, default: 200): Maximum number of measurements to return (default: 200, max: 10000)
- **File:** tool_sensor_history.go

### 14. **query_analytics**
- **Description:** Get usage statistics for MCP tools (call counts, duration). Powered by DuckDB local logs.
- **Parameters:** (none)
- **File:** tool_analytics.go

### 15. **radiation_stats**
- **Description:** Get aggregate radiation statistics from the Safecast database (e.g., average dose rate by year/month). Powered by DuckDB+Postgres.
- **Parameters:**
  - `interval` (string, optional, default: "year"): Aggregation interval: 'year', 'month', or 'overall'
    - Valid values: "year", "month", "overall"

    72→	}
    73→
    74→	// SSE transport (legacy, for existing clients)
    75→	// Note: baseURL should NOT include /mcp — WithStaticBasePath adds it
    76→	sseServer := server.NewSSEServer(mcpServer,
    77→		server.WithBaseURL(baseURL),
    78→		server.WithStaticBasePath("/mcp"),
    79→	)
    80→
    81→	// Streamable HTTP transport (for Claude.ai and modern clients)
    82→	httpServer := server.NewStreamableHTTPServer(mcpServer,
    83→		server.WithEndpointPath("/mcp-http"),
    84→	)
    85→
    86→	// Serve both on the same port
    87→	mux := http.NewServeMux()
    88→	mux.Handle("/mcp-http", httpServer)
    89→	mux.Handle("/", sseServer) // SSE server matches /mcp/sse and /mcp/message internally
    90→
    91→	// Determine listening port (default 3333)
    92→	port := os.Getenv("MCP_PORT")
    93→	if port == "" {
    94→		port = "3333"
    95→	}
    96→	listenAddr := ":" + port
    97→	log.Printf("Starting MCP server on %s", listenAddr)
    98→	log.Println("  SSE endpoint: /mcp/sse")
    99→	log.Println("  Streamable HTTP endpoint: /mcp-http")
   100→	if err := http.ListenAndServe(listenAddr, mux); err != nil {
   101→		log.Fatal(err)
   102→	}
   103→
   104→}
   105→
   106→// instrument wraps a tool handler with logging.
   107→func instrument(name string, h func(context.Context, mcp.CallToolRequest) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error)) func(context.Context, mcp.CallToolRequest) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
   108→	return func(ctx context.Context, req mcp.CallToolRequest) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
   109→        start := time.Now()
   110→        res, err := h(ctx, req)
   111→        duration := time.Since(start)
   112→        
   113→        // Log asynchronously
   114→        resultCount := 0
   115→        if res != nil {
   116→            resultCount = len(res.Content)
   117→        }
   118→        
   119→        // Convert arguments to map[string]any with type assertion
   120→        args := make(map[string]any)
   121→        if req.Params.Arguments != nil {
   122→            if argsMap, ok := req.Params.Arguments.(map[string]any); ok {
   123→                args = argsMap
   124→            }
   125→        }
   126→        
   127→        // We do this in a goroutine to not block the response
   128→        LogQueryAsync(name, args, resultCount, duration, "claude-client") // simplistic client info
   129→        
   130→        return res, err
   131→    }
   132→}
   133→

1→package main
     2→
     3→import (
     4→	"context"
     5→
     6→	"github.com/mark3labs/mcp-go/mcp"
     7→)
     8→
     9→var queryRadiationToolDef = mcp.NewTool("query_radiation",
    10→	mcp.WithDescription("Find radiation measurements near a geographic location. Returns measurements within a specified radius of the given coordinates."),
    11→	mcp.WithNumber("lat",
    12→		mcp.Description("Latitude (-90 to 90)"),
    13→		mcp.Min(-90), mcp.Max(90),
    14→		mcp.Required(),
    15→	),
    16→	mcp.WithNumber("lon",
    17→		mcp.Description("Longitude (-180 to 180)"),

    19→		mcp.Required(),
    20→	),
    21→	mcp.WithNumber("radius_m",
    22→		mcp.Description("Search radius in meters (default: 1500, max: 50000)"),
    23→		mcp.Min(25), mcp.Max(50000),
    24→		mcp.DefaultNumber(1500),
    25→	),
    26→	mcp.WithNumber("limit",
    27→		mcp.Description("Maximum number of results to return (default: 25, max: 10000)"),
    28→		mcp.Min(1), mcp.Max(10000),

    33→
    34→func handleQueryRadiation(ctx context.Context, req mcp.CallToolRequest) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
    35→	lat, err := req.RequireFloat("lat")
    36→	if err != nil {
    37→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
    38→	}
    39→	lon, err := req.RequireFloat("lon")
    40→	if err != nil {
    41→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
    42→	}
    43→	radiusM := req.GetFloat("radius_m", 1500)
    44→	limit := req.GetInt("limit", 25)
    45→
    46→	if lat < -90 || lat > 90 {
    47→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("Latitude must be between -90 and 90"), nil
    48→	}
    49→	if lon < -180 || lon > 180 {
    50→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("Longitude must be between -180 and 180"), nil
    51→	}
    52→	if radiusM < 25 || radiusM > 50000 {
    53→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("Radius must be between 25 and 50000 meters"), nil
    54→	}
    55→	if limit < 1 || limit > 10000 {
    56→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("Limit must be between 1 and 10000"), nil
    57→	}
    58→
    59→	if dbAvailable() {
    60→		return queryRadiationDB(ctx, lat, lon, radiusM, limit)
    61→	}
    62→	return queryRadiationAPI(ctx, lat, lon, radiusM, limit)
    63→}
    64→
    65→func queryRadiationDB(ctx context.Context, lat, lon, radiusM float64, limit int) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
    66→	// Use a bounding box pre-filter (&&) to hit the geometry spatial index first,
    67→	// then refine with ST_DWithin on geography for precise meter-based distance.
    68→	// Without the bbox filter, the geography cast bypasses the index → full table scan → timeout.
    69→	query := `
    70→		SELECT id, doserate AS value, 'µSv/h' AS unit,
    71→			to_timestamp(date) AS captured_at,
    72→			lat AS latitude, lon AS longitude,
    73→			device_id, altitude AS height, detector,
    74→			trackid, has_spectrum,
    75→			ST_Distance(geom::geography, ST_SetSRID(ST_MakePoint($2, $1), 4326)::geography) AS distance_m
    76→		FROM markers
    77→		WHERE geom && ST_Expand(ST_SetSRID(ST_MakePoint($2, $1), 4326), $3 / 111000.0)
    78→		  AND ST_DWithin(geom::geography, ST_SetSRID(ST_MakePoint($2, $1), 4326)::geography, $3)
    79→		ORDER BY date DESC
    80→		LIMIT $4`
    81→
    82→	rows, err := queryRows(ctx, query, lat, lon, radiusM, limit)
    83→	if err != nil {
    84→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
    85→	}
    86→
    87→	// Get total count (with same bbox pre-filter for performance)
    88→	countRow, _ := queryRow(ctx, `
    89→		SELECT count(*) AS total
    90→		FROM markers
    91→		WHERE geom && ST_Expand(ST_SetSRID(ST_MakePoint($2, $1), 4326), $3 / 111000.0)
    92→		  AND ST_DWithin(geom::geography, ST_SetSRID(ST_MakePoint($2, $1), 4326)::geography, $3)`,
    93→		lat, lon, radiusM)
    94→	total := 0
    95→	if countRow != nil {
    96→		if t, ok := countRow["total"]; ok {
    97→			switch v := t.(type) {
    98→			case int64:
    99→				total = int(v)
   100→			case float64:
   101→				total = int(v)
   102→			}
   103→		}
   104→	}
   105→
   106→	measurements := make([]map[string]any, len(rows))
   107→	for i, r := range rows {
   108→		measurements[i] = map[string]any{
   109→			"id":    r["id"],
   110→			"value": r["value"],
   111→			"unit":  r["unit"],
   112→			"captured_at": r["captured_at"],
   113→			"location": map[string]any{
   114→				"latitude":  r["latitude"],
   115→				"longitude": r["longitude"],
   116→			},
   117→			"device_id":    r["device_id"],
   118→			"height":       r["height"],
   119→			"detector":     r["detector"],
   120→			"track_id":     r["trackid"],
   121→			"has_spectrum":  r["has_spectrum"],
   122→			"distance_m":   r["distance_m"],
   123→		}
   124→	}
   125→
   126→	result := map[string]any{
   127→		"count":           len(measurements),
   128→		"total_available": total,
   129→		"source":          "database",
   130→		"query": map[string]any{
   131→			"lat":      lat,
   132→			"lon":      lon,
   133→			"radius_m": radiusM,
   134→		},
   135→		"measurements": measurements,
   136→	}
   137→
   138→	return jsonResult(result)
   139→}
   140→
   141→func queryRadiationAPI(ctx context.Context, lat, lon, radiusM float64, limit int) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
   142→	resp, err := client.GetLatestNearby(ctx, lat, lon, radiusM, limit)
   143→	if err != nil {
   144→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
   145→	}
   146→
   147→	markers, _ := resp["markers"].([]any)
   148→	normalized := make([]map[string]any, 0, len(markers))
   149→	for _, raw := range markers {
   150→		if m, ok := raw.(map[string]any); ok {
   151→			normalized = append(normalized, normalizeLatestMarker(m))
   152→		}
   153→	}
   154→
   155→	result := map[string]any{
   156→		"count":  len(normalized),
   157→		"source": "api",
   158→		"query": map[string]any{
   159→			"lat":      lat,
   160→			"lon":      lon,
   161→			"radius_m": radiusM,
   162→		},
   163→		"measurements": normalized,
   164→	}
   165→
   166→	return jsonResult(result)
   167→}

    39→func handleSearchArea(ctx context.Context, req mcp.CallToolRequest) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {

   102→	total := 0

   114→	measurements := make([]map[string]any, len(rows))

   125→			"device_id":   r["device_id"],
   126→			"height":      r["height"],
   127→			"detector":    r["detector"],
   128→			"track_id":    r["trackid"],

   133→	result := map[string]any{

   149→func searchAreaAPI(ctx context.Context, minLat, maxLat, minLon, maxLon float64, limit int) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {

1→package main
     2→
     3→import (
     4→	"context"
     5→	"fmt"
     6→
     7→	"github.com/mark3labs/mcp-go/mcp"
     8→)
     9→
    10→var getTrackToolDef = mcp.NewTool("get_track",
    11→	mcp.WithDescription("Retrieve all radiation measurements recorded during a specific track/journey. Use list_tracks to find available track IDs first."),
    12→	mcp.WithString("track_id",
    13→		mcp.Description("Track identifier (bGeigie import ID or track ID)"),
    14→		mcp.Required(),
    15→	),
    16→	mcp.WithNumber("from",
    17→		mcp.Description("Optional: Start marker ID for filtering"),
    18→	),
    19→	mcp.WithNumber("to",
    20→		mcp.Description("Optional: End marker ID for filtering"),
    21→	),
    22→	mcp.WithNumber("limit",
    23→		mcp.Description("Maximum number of measurements to return (default: 200, max: 10000)"),
    24→		mcp.Min(1), mcp.Max(10000),
    25→		mcp.DefaultNumber(200),
    26→	),
    27→	mcp.WithReadOnlyHintAnnotation(true),
    28→)
    29→
    30→func handleGetTrack(ctx context.Context, req mcp.CallToolRequest) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
    31→	trackIDStr, err := req.RequireString("track_id")
    32→	if err != nil {
    33→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
    34→	}
    35→
    36→	limit := req.GetInt("limit", 200)
    37→	if limit < 1 || limit > 10000 {
    38→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("Limit must be between 1 and 10000"), nil
    39→	}
    40→
    41→	fromID := req.GetInt("from", 0)
    42→	toID := req.GetInt("to", 0)
    43→
    44→	if dbAvailable() {
    45→		return getTrackDB(ctx, trackIDStr, fromID, toID, limit)
    46→	}
    47→	return getTrackAPI(ctx, trackIDStr, fromID, toID, limit)
    48→}
    49→
    50→func getTrackDB(ctx context.Context, trackID string, fromID, toID, limit int) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
    51→	query := `
    52→		SELECT id, doserate AS value, 'µSv/h' AS unit,
    53→			to_timestamp(date) AS captured_at,
    54→			lat AS latitude, lon AS longitude,
    55→			device_id, altitude AS height, detector,
    56→			has_spectrum
    57→		FROM markers
    58→		WHERE trackid = $1`
    59→
    60→	args := []any{trackID}
    61→	argIdx := 2
    62→
    63→	if fromID != 0 {
    64→		query += fmt.Sprintf(" AND id >= $%d", argIdx)
    65→		args = append(args, fromID)
    66→		argIdx++
    67→	}
    68→	if toID != 0 {
    69→		query += fmt.Sprintf(" AND id <= $%d", argIdx)
    70→		args = append(args, toID)
    71→		argIdx++
    72→	}
    73→
    74→	query += " ORDER BY date ASC"
    75→	query += fmt.Sprintf(" LIMIT $%d", argIdx)
    76→	args = append(args, limit)
    77→
    78→	rows, err := queryRows(ctx, query, args...)
    79→	if err != nil {
    80→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
    81→	}
    82→
    83→	// Get total count for this track
    84→	countRow, _ := queryRow(ctx, `SELECT count(*) AS total FROM markers WHERE trackid = $1`, trackID)
    85→	total := 0
    86→	if countRow != nil {
    87→		if t, ok := countRow["total"]; ok {
    88→			switch v := t.(type) {
    89→			case int64:
    90→				total = int(v)
    91→			case float64:
    92→				total = int(v)
    93→			}
    94→		}
    95→	}
    96→
    97→	measurements := make([]map[string]any, len(rows))
    98→	for i, r := range rows {
    99→		measurements[i] = map[string]any{
   100→			"id":    r["id"],
   101→			"value": r["value"],
   102→			"unit":  r["unit"],
   103→			"captured_at": r["captured_at"],

   109→			"height":      r["height"],

   112→		}
   113→	}
   114→
   115→	result := map[string]any{
   116→		"track_id":        trackID,
   117→		"count":           len(measurements),
   118→		"total_available": total,
   119→		"source":          "database",
   120→		"from_marker":     nilIfZero(fromID),
   121→		"to_marker":       nilIfZero(toID),
   122→		"measurements":    measurements,
   123→	}
   124→
   125→	return jsonResult(result)
   126→}

   128→func getTrackAPI(ctx context.Context, trackIDStr string, fromID, toID, limit int) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {

1→package main
     2→
     3→import (
     4→	"context"

     6→
     7→	"github.com/mark3labs/mcp-go/mcp"
     8→)
     9→
    10→var deviceHistoryToolDef = mcp.NewTool("device_history",
    11→	mcp.WithDescription("Get historical radiation measurements from a specific monitoring device over a time period."),
    12→	mcp.WithString("device_id",
    13→		mcp.Description("Device identifier"),
    14→		mcp.Required(),
    15→	),
    16→	mcp.WithNumber("days",
    17→		mcp.Description("Number of days of history to retrieve (default: 30, max: 365)"),
    18→		mcp.Min(1), mcp.Max(365),
    19→		mcp.DefaultNumber(30),
    20→	),
    21→	mcp.WithNumber("limit",
    22→		mcp.Description("Maximum number of measurements to return (default: 200, max: 10000)"),
    23→		mcp.Min(1), mcp.Max(10000),
    24→		mcp.DefaultNumber(200),
    25→	),
    26→	mcp.WithReadOnlyHintAnnotation(true),
    27→)
    28→
    29→func handleDeviceHistory(ctx context.Context, req mcp.CallToolRequest) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
    30→	deviceIDStr, err := req.RequireString("device_id")
    31→	if err != nil {
    32→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
    33→	}
    34→
    35→	days := req.GetInt("days", 30)
    36→	limit := req.GetInt("limit", 200)
    37→
    38→	if days < 1 || days > 365 {
    39→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("days must be between 1 and 365"), nil
    40→	}
    41→	if limit < 1 || limit > 10000 {
    42→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("Limit must be between 1 and 10000"), nil
    43→	}
    44→
    45→	if dbAvailable() {
    46→		return deviceHistoryDB(ctx, deviceIDStr, days, limit)
    47→	}
    48→	return deviceHistoryAPI(ctx, deviceIDStr, days, limit)
    49→}
    50→
    51→func deviceHistoryDB(ctx context.Context, deviceID string, days, limit int) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
    52→	now := time.Now().UTC()
    53→	startDate := now.AddDate(0, 0, -days)
    54→
    55→	// Query both markers table and realtime_measurements table
    56→	// First, try markers table (bGeigie imports)
    57→	markersQuery := `
    58→		SELECT id, doserate AS value, 'µSv/h' AS unit,
    59→			to_timestamp(date) AS captured_at,
    60→			lat AS latitude, lon AS longitude,
    61→			altitude AS height, detector, trackid::text AS track_id
    62→		FROM markers
    63→		WHERE device_id = $1 AND date >= $2 AND date <= $3
    64→		ORDER BY date DESC
    65→		LIMIT $4`
    66→
    67→	markersRows, err := queryRows(ctx, markersQuery, deviceID, startDate.Unix(), now.Unix(), limit)
    68→	if err != nil {
    69→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
    70→	}
    71→
    72→	// Then, query realtime_measurements table (fixed sensors)
    73→	// First, check if the table exists and what columns it has
    74→	columnsQuery := `
    75→		SELECT column_name
    76→		FROM information_schema.columns
    77→		WHERE table_name = 'realtime_measurements'
    78→		ORDER BY column_name
    79→	`
    80→	
    81→	var realtimeRows []map[string]any
    82→	
    83→	columnRows, err := queryRows(ctx, columnsQuery)
    84→	if err != nil || len(columnRows) == 0 {
    85→		// If we can't query the schema or table doesn't exist, try the basic query
    86→		realtimeQuery := `
    87→			SELECT id, value, unit,
    88→				to_timestamp(measured_at) AS captured_at,
    89→				lat AS latitude, lon AS longitude,
    90→				device_name, transport, device_id
    91→			FROM realtime_measurements
    92→			WHERE device_id = $1 AND measured_at >= $2 AND measured_at <= $3
    93→			ORDER BY measured_at DESC
    94→			LIMIT $4`
    95→
    96→		realtimeRows, err = queryRows(ctx, realtimeQuery, deviceID, startDate.Unix(), now.Unix(), limit)
    97→		if err != nil {
    98→			return mcp.NewToolResultError("Error querying realtime_measurements table: " + err.Error()), nil
    99→		}
   100→	} else {
   101→		// Build the query based on available columns
   102→		hasHeight := false
   103→		for _, row := range columnRows {
   104→			if colName, ok := row["column_name"].(string); ok && colName == "height" {
   105→				hasHeight = true
   106→				break
   107→			}
   108→		}
   109→		
   110→		var realtimeQuery string
   111→		if hasHeight {
   112→			realtimeQuery = `
   113→				SELECT id, value, unit,
   114→					to_timestamp(measured_at) AS captured_at,
   115→					lat AS latitude, lon AS longitude,
   116→					device_name, transport, device_id, height
   117→				FROM realtime_measurements
   118→				WHERE device_id = $1 AND measured_at >= $2 AND measured_at <= $3
   119→				ORDER BY measured_at DESC
   120→				LIMIT $4`
   121→		} else {
   122→			realtimeQuery = `
   123→				SELECT id, value, unit,
   124→					to_timestamp(measured_at) AS captured_at,
   125→					lat AS latitude, lon AS longitude,
   126→					device_name, transport, device_id
   127→				FROM realtime_measurements
   128→				WHERE device_id = $1 AND measured_at >= $2 AND measured_at <= $3
   129→				ORDER BY measured_at DESC
   130→				LIMIT $4`
   131→		}
   132→
   133→		realtimeRows, err = queryRows(ctx, realtimeQuery, deviceID, startDate.Unix(), now.Unix(), limit)
   134→		if err != nil {
   135→			return mcp.NewToolResultError("Error querying realtime_measurements table: " + err.Error()), nil
   136→		}
   137→	}
   138→
   139→	// Combine results and sort by timestamp (most recent first)
   140→	allMeasurements := make([]map[string]any, 0, len(markersRows)+len(realtimeRows))
   141→	
   142→	// Process markers results
   143→	for _, r := range markersRows {
   144→		measurement := map[string]any{
   145→			"id":    r["id"],
   146→			"value": r["value"],
   147→			"unit":  r["unit"],
   148→			"captured_at": r["captured_at"],
   149→			"location": map[string]any{
   150→				"latitude":  r["latitude"],
   151→				"longitude": r["longitude"],
   152→			},
   153→			"height":   r["height"],
   154→			"detector": r["detector"],
   155→			"source":   "bgeigie_import",
   156→		}
   157→		if r["track_id"] != nil {
   158→			measurement["track_id"] = r["track_id"]
   159→		}
   160→		allMeasurements = append(allMeasurements, measurement)
   161→	}
   162→	
   163→	// Process realtime results
   164→	for _, r := range realtimeRows {
   165→		measurement := map[string]any{
   166→			"id":    r["id"],
   167→			"value": r["value"],
   168→			"unit":  r["unit"],
   169→			"captured_at": r["captured_at"],
   170→			"location": map[string]any{
   171→				"latitude":  r["latitude"],
   172→				"longitude": r["longitude"],
   173→			},
   174→			"height":   r["height"],
   175→			"device_name": r["device_name"],
   176→			"type":     r["transport"],
   177→			"source":   "realtime_sensor",
   178→		}
   179→		allMeasurements = append(allMeasurements, measurement)
   180→	}
   181→
   182→	// Sort all measurements by captured_at timestamp (most recent first)
   183→	// Since queryRows returns timestamps as interface{}, we need to handle both string and time.Time types
   184→	for i := 0; i < len(allMeasurements)-1; i++ {
   185→		for j := 0; j < len(allMeasurements)-i-1; j++ {
   186→			// Get the timestamp values - they could be strings or time.Time objects
   187→			time1Val := allMeasurements[j]["captured_at"]
   188→			time2Val := allMeasurements[j+1]["captured_at"]
   189→			
   190→			// Compare timestamps - swap if j-th element is older than (j+1)-th element
   191→			shouldSwap := false
   192→			
   193→			// Handle different possible types for timestamps
   194→			switch v1 := time1Val.(type) {
   195→			case string:
   196→				if v2, ok := time2Val.(string); ok {
   197→					if v1 < v2 {
   198→						shouldSwap = true
   199→					}
   200→				}
   201→			case time.Time:
   202→				if v2, ok := time2Val.(time.Time); ok {
   203→					if v1.Before(v2) {
   204→						shouldSwap = true
   205→					}
   206→				}
   207→			}
   208→			
   209→			if shouldSwap {
   210→				allMeasurements[j], allMeasurements[j+1] = allMeasurements[j+1], allMeasurements[j]
   211→			}
   212→		}
   213→	}
   214→
   215→	// Apply limit
   216→	measurements := allMeasurements
   217→	if len(measurements) > limit {
   218→		measurements = measurements[:limit]
   219→	}
   220→
   221→	capturedAfter := startDate.Format("2006-01-02") + " 00:00"
   222→	capturedBefore := now.Format("2006-01-02") + " 23:59"
   223→
   224→	result := map[string]any{
   225→		"device": map[string]any{
   226→			"id": deviceID,
   227→		},
   228→		"period": map[string]any{
   229→			"days":       days,
   230→			"start_date": capturedAfter,
   231→			"end_date":   capturedBefore,
   232→		},
   233→		"count":        len(measurements),
   234→		"source":       "database",
   235→		"measurements": measurements,
   236→	}
   237→
   238→	return jsonResult(result)
   239→}

   241→func deviceHistoryAPI(ctx context.Context, deviceIDStr string, days, limit int) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
   242→	resp, err := client.GetRealtimeHistory(ctx, deviceIDStr)
   243→	if err != nil {
   244→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
   245→	}
   246→
   247→	now := time.Now().UTC()
   248→	startDate := now.AddDate(0, 0, -days)
   249→	capturedAfter := startDate.Format("2006-01-02") + " 00:00"
   250→	capturedBefore := now.Format("2006-01-02") + " 23:59"
   251→	startUnix := startDate.Unix()
   252→
   253→	// Extract dose rate time series and filter by date range
   254→	var measurements []map[string]any
   255→	if series, ok := resp["series"].(map[string]any); ok {
   256→		if doseRate, ok := series["doseRate"].([]any); ok {
   257→			for _, raw := range doseRate {
   258→				pt, ok := raw.(map[string]any)
   259→				if !ok {
   260→					continue
   261→				}
   262→				ts, ok := toFloat(pt["time"])
   263→				if !ok || int64(ts) < startUnix {
   264→					continue
   265→				}
   266→				t := time.Unix(int64(ts), 0).UTC()
   267→				measurements = append(measurements, map[string]any{
   268→					"value":       pt["value"],
   269→					"unit":        "µSv/h",
   270→					"captured_at": t.Format(time.RFC3339),
   271→				})
   272→			}
   273→		}
   274→	}
   275→
   276→	totalAvailable := len(measurements)
   277→	if limit > len(measurements) {
   278→		limit = len(measurements)
   279→	}
   280→	measurements = measurements[:limit]
   281→
   282→	deviceInfo := map[string]any{
   283→		"id": deviceIDStr,
   284→	}
   285→	if name, ok := resp["deviceName"].(string); ok && name != "" {
   286→		deviceInfo["name"] = name
   287→	}
   288→	if tube, ok := resp["tube"].(string); ok && tube != "" {
   289→		deviceInfo["sensor"] = tube
   290→	}
   291→
   292→	result := map[string]any{
   293→		"device": deviceInfo,
   294→		"period": map[string]any{
   295→			"days":       days,
   296→			"start_date": capturedAfter,
   297→			"end_date":   capturedBefore,
   298→		},
   299→		"count":           len(measurements),
   300→		"total_available": totalAvailable,
   301→		"source":          "api",
   302→		"measurements":    measurements,
   303→	}
   304→
   305→	if ranges, ok := resp["ranges"].(map[string]any); ok {
   306→		if dr, ok := ranges["doseRate"].(map[string]any); ok {
   307→			result["statistics"] = map[string]any{
   308→				"min_usvh": dr["min"],
   309→				"max_usvh": dr["max"],
   310→				"avg_usvh": dr["avg"],
   311→			}
   312→		}
   313→	}
   314→
   315→	return jsonResult(result)
   316→}
   317→

    11→	mcp.WithDescription("Browse gamma spectroscopy records. Returns metadata without channel data. Use get_spectrum with a marker_id from results to fetch full channel data. Can filter by track ID, geographic bounds, file format, or device model. Call with no filters to get all spectra."),
    12→	mcp.WithNumber("min_lat",
    13→		mcp.Description("Southern boundary latitude (requires all 4 bbox params)"),
    14→		mcp.Min(-90), mcp.Max(90),
    15→	),
    16→	mcp.WithNumber("max_lat",
    17→		mcp.Description("Northern boundary latitude (requires all 4 bbox params)"),
    18→		mcp.Min(-90), mcp.Max(90),
    19→	),
    20→	mcp.WithNumber("min_lon",
    21→		mcp.Description("Western boundary longitude (requires all 4 bbox params)"),
    22→		mcp.Min(-180), mcp.Max(180),
    23→	),
    24→	mcp.WithNumber("max_lon",
    25→		mcp.Description("Eastern boundary longitude (requires all 4 bbox params)"),
    26→		mcp.Min(-180), mcp.Max(180),
    27→	),
    28→	mcp.WithString("source_format",
    29→		mcp.Description("Filter by spectrum file format (e.g., 'spe', 'csv')"),
    30→	),
    31→	mcp.WithString("device_model",
    32→		mcp.Description("Filter by detector/device model name"),
    33→	),
    34→	mcp.WithString("track_id",
    35→		mcp.Description("Filter by track identifier (e.g., '8eh5m1', '8ZnI7f')"),
    36→	),
    37→	mcp.WithNumber("limit",
    38→		mcp.Description("Maximum number of results to return (default: 50, max: 500)"),
    39→		mcp.Min(1), mcp.Max(500),
    40→		mcp.DefaultNumber(50),
    41→	),
    42→	mcp.WithReadOnlyHintAnnotation(true),

    44→
    45→func handleListSpectra(ctx context.Context, req mcp.CallToolRequest) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
    46→	if !dbAvailable() {
    47→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("list_spectra requires a database connection (no REST API fallback available)"), nil
    48→	}
    49→
    50→	// Check which bbox params were provided
    51→	argsMap, _ := req.Params.Arguments.(map[string]any)
    52→	if argsMap == nil {
    53→		argsMap = map[string]any{}
    54→	}
    55→	_, hasMinLat := argsMap["min_lat"]
    56→	_, hasMaxLat := argsMap["max_lat"]
    57→	_, hasMinLon := argsMap["min_lon"]
    58→	_, hasMaxLon := argsMap["max_lon"]
    59→	hasBBox := hasMinLat || hasMaxLat || hasMinLon || hasMaxLon
    60→
    61→	var minLat, maxLat, minLon, maxLon float64
    62→	if hasBBox {
    63→		if !(hasMinLat && hasMaxLat && hasMinLon && hasMaxLon) {
    64→			return mcp.NewToolResultError("All four bounding box parameters (min_lat, max_lat, min_lon, max_lon) must be provided together"), nil
    65→		}
    66→		minLat = req.GetFloat("min_lat", 0)
    67→		maxLat = req.GetFloat("max_lat", 0)
    68→		minLon = req.GetFloat("min_lon", 0)
    69→		maxLon = req.GetFloat("max_lon", 0)
    70→		if minLat < -90 || minLat > 90 || maxLat < -90 || maxLat > 90 {
    71→			return mcp.NewToolResultError("Latitude must be between -90 and 90"), nil
    72→		}
    73→		if minLon < -180 || minLon > 180 || maxLon < -180 || maxLon > 180 {
    74→			return mcp.NewToolResultError("Longitude must be between -180 and 180"), nil
    75→		}
    76→		if minLat >= maxLat {
    77→			return mcp.NewToolResultError("min_lat must be less than max_lat"), nil
    78→		}
    79→		if minLon >= maxLon {
    80→			return mcp.NewToolResultError("min_lon must be less than max_lon"), nil
    81→		}
    82→	}
    83→
    84→	sourceFormat := req.GetString("source_format", "")
    85→	deviceModel := req.GetString("device_model", "")
    86→	trackID := req.GetString("track_id", "")
    87→	limit := req.GetInt("limit", 50)
    88→	if limit < 1 || limit > 500 {
    89→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("Limit must be between 1 and 500"), nil
    90→	}
    91→
    92→	return listSpectraDB(ctx, hasBBox, minLat, maxLat, minLon, maxLon, sourceFormat, deviceModel, trackID, limit)
    93→}
    94→
    95→func listSpectraDB(ctx context.Context, hasBBox bool, minLat, maxLat, minLon, maxLon float64, sourceFormat, deviceModel, trackID string, limit int) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
    96→	// Exclude s.channels to avoid huge payloads
    97→	baseSelect := `SELECT s.id, s.marker_id, s.channel_count, s.energy_min_kev, s.energy_max_kev,
    98→			s.live_time_sec, s.real_time_sec, s.device_model, s.calibration,
    99→			s.source_format, s.filename, s.created_at,
   100→			m.doserate, m.lat, m.lon, to_timestamp(m.date) AS captured_at,
   101→			m.trackid AS track_id
   102→		FROM spectra s
   103→		JOIN markers m ON m.id = s.marker_id
   104→		WHERE 1=1`
   105→
   106→	countBase := `SELECT count(*) AS total
   107→		FROM spectra s
   108→		JOIN markers m ON m.id = s.marker_id
   109→		WHERE 1=1`
   110→
   111→	args := []any{}
   112→	countArgs := []any{}
   113→	argIdx := 1
   114→	countArgIdx := 1
   115→
   116→	if hasBBox {
   117→		clause := fmt.Sprintf(" AND m.geom && ST_MakeEnvelope($%d, $%d, $%d, $%d, 4326)",
   118→			argIdx, argIdx+1, argIdx+2, argIdx+3)
   119→		baseSelect += clause
   120→		args = append(args, minLon, minLat, maxLon, maxLat)
   121→		argIdx += 4
   122→
   123→		countClause := fmt.Sprintf(" AND m.geom && ST_MakeEnvelope($%d, $%d, $%d, $%d, 4326)",
   124→			countArgIdx, countArgIdx+1, countArgIdx+2, countArgIdx+3)
   125→		countBase += countClause
   126→		countArgs = append(countArgs, minLon, minLat, maxLon, maxLat)
   127→		countArgIdx += 4
   128→	}
   129→
   130→	if sourceFormat != "" {
   131→		baseSelect += fmt.Sprintf(" AND s.source_format = $%d", argIdx)
   132→		args = append(args, sourceFormat)
   133→		argIdx++
   134→
   135→		countBase += fmt.Sprintf(" AND s.source_format = $%d", countArgIdx)
   136→		countArgs = append(countArgs, sourceFormat)
   137→		countArgIdx++
   138→	}
   139→
   140→	if deviceModel != "" {
   141→		baseSelect += fmt.Sprintf(" AND s.device_model ILIKE $%d", argIdx)
   142→		args = append(args, "%"+deviceModel+"%")
   143→		argIdx++
   144→
   145→		countBase += fmt.Sprintf(" AND s.device_model ILIKE $%d", countArgIdx)
   146→		countArgs = append(countArgs, "%"+deviceModel+"%")
   147→		countArgIdx++
   148→	}
   149→
   150→	if trackID != "" {
   151→		baseSelect += fmt.Sprintf(" AND m.trackid = $%d", argIdx)
   152→		args = append(args, trackID)
   153→		argIdx++
   154→
   155→		countBase += fmt.Sprintf(" AND m.trackid = $%d", countArgIdx)
   156→		countArgs = append(countArgs, trackID)
   157→		countArgIdx++
   158→	}
   159→
   160→	baseSelect += " ORDER BY s.created_at DESC"
   161→	baseSelect += fmt.Sprintf(" LIMIT $%d", argIdx)
   162→	args = append(args, limit)
   163→
   164→	rows, err := queryRows(ctx, baseSelect, args...)
   165→	if err != nil {
   166→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
   167→	}
   168→
   169→	countRow, _ := queryRow(ctx, countBase, countArgs...)
   170→	total := 0
   171→	if countRow != nil {
   172→		if t, ok := countRow["total"]; ok {
   173→			switch v := t.(type) {
   174→			case int64:
   175→				total = int(v)
   176→			case float64:
   177→				total = int(v)
   178→			}
   179→		}
   180→	}
   181→
   182→	spectra := make([]map[string]any, len(rows))
   183→	for i, r := range rows {
   184→		spectra[i] = map[string]any{
   185→			"spectrum_id":    r["id"],
   186→			"marker_id":     r["marker_id"],
   187→			"filename":      r["filename"],
   188→			"source_format": r["source_format"],
   189→			"device_model":  r["device_model"],
   190→			"channel_count": r["channel_count"],
   191→			"energy_range": map[string]any{
   192→				"min_kev": r["energy_min_kev"],
   193→				"max_kev": r["energy_max_kev"],
   194→			},
   195→			"live_time_sec": r["live_time_sec"],
   196→			"real_time_sec": r["real_time_sec"],
   197→			"calibration":   r["calibration"],
   198→			"created_at":    r["created_at"],
   199→			"marker": map[string]any{
   200→				"doserate":    r["doserate"],
   201→				"latitude":    r["lat"],
   202→				"longitude":   r["lon"],
   203→				"captured_at": r["captured_at"],
   204→				"track_id":    r["track_id"],
   205→			},
   206→		}
   207→	}
   208→
   209→	filters := map[string]any{}
   210→	if hasBBox {
   211→		filters["bbox"] = map[string]any{
   212→			"min_lat": minLat, "max_lat": maxLat,
   213→			"min_lon": minLon, "max_lon": maxLon,
   214→		}
   215→	}
   216→	if sourceFormat != "" {
   217→		filters["source_format"] = sourceFormat
   218→	}
   219→	if deviceModel != "" {
   220→		filters["device_model"] = deviceModel
   221→	}
   222→	if trackID != "" {
   223→		filters["track_id"] = trackID
   224→	}
   225→
   226→	result := map[string]any{
   227→		"count":           len(spectra),
   228→		"total_available": total,
   229→		"source":          "database",
   230→		"filters":         filters,
   231→		"spectra":         spectra,
   232→	}
   233→
   234→	return jsonResult(result)
   235→}
   236→
